Key Match Events: Bassitt struck out the final batter of the first inning with the bases loaded to escape any additional damage.
Bassitt retired 13 straight hitters, striking out seven more in that stretch.
Brayan Bello threw a career-high eight innings, allowing just two hits and one walk while striking out nine.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The righty struck out the first two batters he faced in the second inning.
Bassitt switched his spot up on the mound from the first base side of the rubber to the third base side, which allowed him far greater access to a bevy of his pitches.
Bassitt’s line on the night read 6 2/3 innings, one run allowed, five hits, one walk and nine strikeouts.
Bassitt’s nine strikeouts matched a season-high, accomplished earlier this month against Baltimore.
